Ratings.comment: A GE SHOULD NOT BE THIS HARD. A LOT  OF WRITING INVOLVED

Angerman's Slavic film class is an excellent GEC. Her teaching style invites a lot of class participation. The movies were varied and always interesting. The reading material got kind of heavy at times, but nothing insurmountable. No surprises on tests assuming you paid attention during class and watched the movies. Recommend.

Excellent TA! Her class is the best class I have had at OSU. She is extremely well informed on the subject matter and offers  an interesting lecture. Her syllabus is extremely clear about what she expects from the student. She is also open minded and encourages critical thinking. The movies she chose were pretty cool too.

Very easy.  You basically watch a movie one day, then discuss it in the next class.  The insructor does most of the talking, and when she asks questions you better respond or else she gets mad and threatens pop quizzes (never happened).  She makes the material sound demanding but in the end your grade won't reflect it (B-A range)

Very strict professor. Requires from you to be very precise in your answers and does not explain what you did wrong when grading your work. You have to go and talk to her in order to understand what exactly you did wrong. For a GEC course, it should not be this hard, you also feel very overwhelmed with the material. The only good thing is that out

A professor I will remember for the rest of my life! He is extremely knowledgeable in film production and will never shy away from helping and guiding students who seek his direction. He keeps it real at all times and is passionate about bringing out your best potential. David is one of the best Professor's OSU has to offer!

One of the best professors I have ever had. If you do all the classwork plus a couple of "explorations" as he calls them, it is an easy A. If you need to miss a class you can join a live stream on discord. There are no tests, just many short responses(200-400 words).

Dr. J is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. You can really tell how much he cares for his students, especially during the online semester. His class was fairly easy, and the content we covered in his course was super interesting as well. There is a textbook for the class that we used, but he posts pdfs of everything we need

Great class and great professor. He clearly cared about what he was teaching, and made the class super interesting. He assigned a little more work than i expected for a criticizing tv class, but it was very do-able - he graded easily and allowed revisions on papers after he graded them.

He actually gets to know his students. He memorized all of our names by the third class. You do have to put in some effort for papers ect., but he gives you plenty of time and you actually learn something in his class.

Christopher Jeansonne is honestly one of the best professors I have had. He is very caring for his students and will openly listen to anything whether it be related to the course or not. I used him as a resource for a project outside the class and he was very helpful

She was a harsher grader than other Italian professors and graded you on your written homework even though the syllabus said that the written homework was graded on completion. 
However, she was kind and helped when I was confused, and as long as you put effort into the class you should be fine.

The class itself is really straightforward but Hannah is a bit condescending, especially about pronunciation. She also grades much more harshly than other italian professors, which I dont think is fair considering the course should be standardized. Also did not ever answer emails in a timely manner. Not that bad that you should switch out though.

WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD. She genuinely does not teach anything she just expects you to teach yourself the material using the textbook and come to class knowing it already. She doesnt use notes. Had over 3 hours of homework a night. Do not ever take her for anything or you will cry I promise. She should not be allowed to teach ever again.

Mafia movies is a lot of work but the content can be very fun. However, this TA is hardcore. Very dismissive and distant to us students wish I had a TA that felt human. Attendance is a grade and if you do something she doesn't like you will hear about it.

I looked forward to his classes. Amazing teacher all around. I learned so much about composition in this class, everything from narratives to annotated bibliographys. Would definatly take another course of his.
Super passionate and clearly knowledgeable about the content.  Class consisted of eleven quizzes, two scene analyses, and a final, which weren't bad at all.

Great Professor.  Granted he makes you work hard in his classes but his wit and charm keep you interested and he always makes time to meet with students to discuss the course work.  I took classes from him at Devry University also, he is one of the best instructors I had that was intelligent and really cared about learning.

He was a terrible teacher. The course covered society and technology. He had a modi****of internet ability. Often times he would flounder at the computer as the class attempted to help him browse google; google people, for god's sake, google. He offered little analysis worth thinking about and his exams asked nothing of the students. I give him an
He's a good teacher, interesting in lectures. Distinctively dressed. Wit and charm. I'd recommend.

I think it would be lot better, if the instructor is not trying to be smart and trick people in quizes and those long essay exams. I mean, if a student comes all classes, do all assignments, and a hard working person, then he/she should get a good grade. Because the person is doing the best it can!

I like the materials in the class, I think it will help my future busness, but the notes are pain in the a**. The tests and quizes are hard and tricky, you have to really get in to R.Preissle's head to figure it out. lots of reading, papers, and notes. Good Luck who ever going to take his class!

Comp. Studies 597.01 was a very interesting class. Although the notes were a pain, Prof. Preissle was very good at keeping everyone interested and involved. I enjoyed his style of teaching (excluding the long notes).

I had Preissle for my film and lit class and I thought it was a really fun class to take.  There are weekly papers (2 pgs) and quizzes (15 Qs,mult. ch.) but it's VERY easy to get 100%s on all of them.  The course paper (not a research paper) is also easy, 6 pages, i wrote it in 2 hours. You just have to study for his essay midterm and final.

Professor Petten is a really nice guy but his lectures were confusing. His vocabulary is expansive and I had to look up a lot of the words he used in lecture. That being said, he was more than happy to explain things if asked. TA graded exams (which are all essay) & randomly marked off points without explanation. Would not recommend as a GE class.

Intro to World Cinema was interesting & Professor Petten is genuinely interested in what he teaches.  Lectures were long but for the most part, necessary.  I greatly appreciated that he always started & ended on time, that he was very open to questions & in fact would always stay after class and answer questions.  I thought he was extremely fair.

He merely lectures at the class with minimal powerpoint usage - difficult to follow him and he often uses unnecessarily complicated words to confound his point. The final grade is composed of three in-class exams, for which we are assigned essays that are graded without any objective rubric. TAs take off points arbitrarily and can't explain why.

Petten is a professor who is extremely boring but gets the point across (although his use of over-complex vocabulary sometimes skews the message). If you take good notes, you will not have to read and should do well on the exams. Just drink some coffee before lecture because that's all this man does - lecture.

Had him for Intro to World Cinema. He only put bullets on powerpoints so you need to show up to take notes on what he actually says and watch the clips of the films even though they can be boring. If you take good notes you'll get an easy A.

As a science major, I only took her class as a GE, and it was so worth it. The topic was horror films which you could tell she was passionate about, which made the class super interesting . The pop quizzes are open-book and easy as long as you take notes in class and watch the movies. Use her office hours for her to read your papers!

She's funny, and a knowledgable lecturer. No-nonsense on phones/chatting/looking tired. Come prepared. You'll get out what you put in with her, and her comments on papers are very helpful. I'd take her again. Beware pop quizzes, and get ready to take notes: as a point she doesn't publish her slides. For 2271 she gave detailed rubrics.
She does not make a rubric for any of her assignments.   She is in a bad mood every day.  looking at her makes me think I should have never gone to college.
